comment: hate him

2 tests on 8 chapters each and one project grade. He could not care less about his students and his lectures are not useful at all. Very disrespectful to his students when questions were asked. He is very old and is starting to loose alot of his ability. If you do bad on anything you are screwed.

Holds grades hostage until they are final. He doesn't teach. two tests, a project, and participation make up the class. If you are looking to learn then he isn't your guy, but if you are looking to make an easy grade then he is.

Professor Fatehi is an absolute sweetheart, and I really enjoyed him throughout the semester as a person, but sometimes his lectures became very confusing. He would often go into random tangents, which would be okay but as a person who gets distracted easily, I would get lost. I do think he is a good mentor though, and it was an easy grade.
He made a specific effort to make sure I did my best. I enjoyed his class and would recommend you take it, just make sure you read the book.

Course is interesting because it is an interesting topic. He doesn't ever mention anything about the course, though. Very unorganized & all over the place. He is friendly but you must teach yourself. 2 tests, one of which he gave our class the wrong test so we only got one grade counted. one group project. Easy course, would recommend for easy A

He doesn't really teach.  Seriously, he goes off on long tangents about random stuff that has nothing to do with the material.  I think he is tired of teaching.  Don't waste your time or money on this class.  If you don't buy his book, you won't pass his tests.  Don't expect to receive a grade on anything.

He created a seating chart and before every single class he would check to make sure everyone was in their assigned seat.  This took up to 45 minutes during one class.  It is ridiculous how he cares so much for the seating chart but hardly goes over the powerpoint's.    Just read the book to pass.  A bad teacher overall.

Have to purchase the WallStreet Journal & participate in presenting an article from the paper you get called on to speak; if you don't have something to talk about, you lose participation credit. 2 exams, group project, APA assignment, and the participation from the WallStreet. He also wrote the textbook that's required & requires seating chart.
He loves stories and does a good job connecting concepts to real scenarios. Classes are sometimes all over the place, but it's okay. Tests are mainly from the book, which he wrote.

Nope nope nope. Do not take this class if you do not have to! (Or unless you like easy boring classes.) I hardly read the book and I skated by with ease! The test materials were entirely common sense. This being said, you will experience death by Powerpoint a billion times over. There is a group project that we finished in a day. Go elsewhere!

He is very unorganized and never answers your questions. He creates a seating chart which is annoying and seems to just wing his classes. His test are out off of the book and power point. You will have to teach yourself to do well in this class. He grade attendance and class participation but will never post grades to d2l, he should stop teaching.

Not pleased with the overall quality of teaching.  He uses the power points that the book supplied and most of the time has no idea what is on them. How ever the tests are easy directly out of the book and multiple choice.

Google his name there is an article by creative loafing which will give you an idea about his character and respect for others. Creates ambiguity with his grading and justification for grades are many times not given. A lot of work. You will learn mostly on your own due to the number of assignments. Disrespectful at times. Do Not Take Him.

Not a hard course. He is a very respected professor world wide. He definitely helps you to know what is going on in the business world and further teaches you concepts you have learned previously, but he is basically building onto your knowledge. Kinda giving you some experience. Very nice and respectful to you. 3 tests and a project. I got an A.

Waste of money. Want a passing grade - take this class. Want knowledge - stay away from this class. You will not get too much from the class. This is one of those BS classes. You can study the entire semester worth of work in just couple of hours.

Dr. Fatehi is a very experienced professor with plenty of good information.  Going to class is required and there is quite a bit of work in this class as you have to submit an essay every week.  However, this class is very much worth it as you will gain significant knowledge.  The tests are full essay and you do not get much time so study hard.

I enjoyed many of the stories and applications of the concepts learned in class, and the workload was pretty fair. My complaint would be that the test questions had mostly to do with the textbook and powerpoints more than the material actually discussed in class.  I got a decent grade, but it wasn't easy, for sure.

Don't bother. Goes off on tangents about his excursions, not very clear AT ALL with what material to study for his exams. Two tests make up HALF of your grade! Class isn't mandatory yet he takes attendance? Very smart teacher only he can't use that intelligence and apply it to a way his students can comprehend what he is trying to say.
Wonderful book!! I am reading it like an enterntainment. Thank you!!

Clairty was a 3 just because we had to buy his book, but it hadn't been published yet, so we got his rough copy which was really hard to get through.  His knowledge is vast and great and he loves his class.  Great professor and great class.

ALL HE DOES IS TELL STORIES, AND HE DOES NOT TEACH US THE CHAPTERS, WHEN IT IS TEST TIME, THERE ARE ONLY TWO TESTS AND 8 CHAPTERS ON EACH AND YOU DO TEACH YOURSELF. IF YOUR GOOD AND MEMORIZING AND LIKE TO SHOW UP TO CLASS HERE AND THERE THAN TAKE THE CLASS, IF YOU NEED SOMEONE TO ACTUALLY TEACH YOU DON'T TAKE HIS CLASS.
Nice teacher, but hard class. You are required to practically teach yourself. Great guy, just a hard class. Little hard to understand his accent.
lectures are pretty dry, and most test material comes from the book, which he wrote by the way.  Attendance seems optional, but is helpful for a good grade.
